        <div class="blog-post">
         <div class="blog-heading">
          <h1>
           Top 6 Reasons Your Business Needs a Mobile Friendly Site
          </h1>
         </div>
         <div class="blog-meta meta-detailed">
          <div class="author-image">
           <a href="https://www.hudsonhorizons.com/blog/author/zainabouseido">
            <img alt="" src="/pub/blogauthor/20140103134612_484813_4391441827614_760456026_n.jpg"/>
           </a>
          </div>
          <div class="meta-right">
           <p class="author">
            <a href="https://www.hudsonhorizons.com/blog/author/zainabouseido">
             Zain Abouseido
            </a>
           </p>
           <p class="date">
            December 05, 2013
           </p>
          </div>
          <!-- end of meta-right -->
         </div>
         <!-- end of blog-meta -->
         <div class="blog-image blog-single-image flexFill">
          <img alt="Top 6 Reasons Your Business Needs a Mobile Friendly Site" src="/pub/blogimages/20131205104708_Smartphone2.jpg"/>
         </div>
         <!-- end of blog-image -->
         <div class="blog-text">
          <p class="Body">
           The
           <a href="http://www.smartinsights.com/mobile-marketing/mobile-marketing-analytics/mobile-marketing-statistics/" target="_blank">
            Mobile Marketing Statistics for 2013
           </a>
           suggest that by 2014, mobile Internet will overtake desktop Internet usage. This shift marks a significant change in the way users consume information online. How can your business keep up with this change? The best solution is to make sure that your businesss website is optimized for both computer and mobile access.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           Here are the top six reasons why your business should hop on the mobile bandwagon:
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Mobile devices are on the rise
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           A
           <a href="http://www.google.com/think/research-studies/the-mobile-movement.html" target="_blank">
            study conducted by Ipsos OTX
           </a>
           across more than 5,000 US adult smartphone Internet users showed that 77 percent of users visit search engine websites using smartphones. In other words, many of us use our smartphones to search the Web just as much as we use our computers. Because your businesss customers likely fall into this statistic, it would be silly to create a website unable to scale for mobile viewing.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Better mobile experience for users
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           You may notice that desktop versions of websites become difficult to use on smartphones. Users have to zoom in and out to view the content, making the experience tedious.
           <a href="http://googlemobileads.blogspot.com/2012/09/mobile-friendly-sites-turn-visitors.html" target="_blank">
            Google conducted a study
           </a>
           that showed 61percent of mobile users are more likely to leave a site if it is not mobile-friendly. On the other hand, mobile-compatible websites are much easier to navigate, which is crucial for gaining and retaining customers. Remember: the user-friendly website will always make more sales than the complicated or incompatible website.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Inexpensive
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           Mobile websites are less expensive to design and develop than desktop websites. Mobile screens are smaller than regular desktop screens, meaning there is only room for the necessities. Sure, you can create an app, but its much more cost-effective to implement a scalable website. And who isnt looking to save money?
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Easy and quick accessibility
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           Consumers today have an on-the go attitude about searching. An Internet user wants easy and quick access to your businesss contact information, hours of operation, and services.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Higher search rankings
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           Google, Yahoo!, Bing, and other search engines rank mobile-optimized businesses higher than their competition. Mobile-friendly websites mean better
           <a href="http://www.hudsonhorizons.com/blog/seo-for-beginners.htm" target="_blank">
            SEO
           </a>
           , which results in a higher listing and more consumer exposure. Think of being at the top of a Google search as being the lead actor or actress in a film. You notice the other characters on screen, but only the important ones stand out.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           <strong>
            Provide a place for eCommerce Transaction
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           A mobile-optimized site provides another outlet to make eCommerce transactions. Imagine the significant sales increase as the result of implementing a mobile-friendly design. Users are less likely to look elsewhere if your website allows them to make direct transactions instantly through their mobile phones.
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
          </p>
          <p class="Body">
           If youre thinking about moving your businesss website to the land of mobile, then youre on the right path. A mobile-friendly website will increase your websites traffic, boost up your search engine rankings, and provide a pleasant experience for both your business and your customers alike.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- end of blog-text -->

            <a href="https://www.hudsonhorizons.com/blog/author/zainabouseido">
             Zain Abouseido
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </div>
          <!-- end of meta-right -->
          <div class="bio-container">
           <p>
            Zain Abouseido is a recent graduate from Rutgers University where she majored in Journalism and Media Studies. She is currently a Public Relations Strategist at Hudson Horizons where she looks forward to learning more about social media in a professional setting. Zain enjoys writing, traveling, and sports.
           </p>
